chapter.title: Using Sets
chapter.para: A set is a book that contains a collection of other books. The Services Plan for example is a book comprised of many other books such as the Developer Guide, Engineering Content Services Guide and the Engineering Operations Guide, to name just a few. The create_book command creates sets by setting the type parameter to Set.

section.title: Creating a Set
section.para: The procedure that follows will guide you through the process of creating a set named My Set containing Book A, Book B and Book C.

important.para: This process assumes that Book A, Book B and Book C already exists and are avaialable in your SVN repository. Currently publican only supports SVN.

step.para: Run the following command in a shell to create a set named My_Set branded in the Red Hat style.
Edit the Makefile and change the following 2 lines from:
step.programlisting: BOOKS = Book_A Book_B Book_C SET_REPO = http://PATH-TO-YOUR-SVN-REPOSITORY

important.para: When building a set, the make clean_ids command will be run over each book because of the constraint that ID's must be unique across all books. Be careful of creating IDs that rely on content that may not be avaialable when building books independently of the set.
